node.title: Speculation over 'hidden message' in Peng Shuai selfie
node.alt: A selfie taken by Peng Shuai holding a Kung Fu Panda doll.
node.description: A photo frame featuring Winnie the Pooh in one of Peng Shuai's selfies has some people speculating it could be a subtle hint from the Chinese tennis star.
node.content: ["A photo of Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai posted on Twitter by a Chinese state media reporter has been fuelling online debate.", "On Saturday, Shen Shiwei from CGTN, the English-language arm of China Central Television, posted photos of a seemingly happy Ms Peng\u00a0on Twitter, which is officially blocked in China.", "The state TV employee wrote the photos were posted on Ms Peng's WeChat account\u00a0with the comment, \"Happy Weekend\".", "They were the first photos of Ms Peng since\u00a0her apparent disappearance earlier this month, after she publicly accused a former high ranking Communist Party leader of sexual assault.", "While some have debated whether or not the photos are\u00a0proof that she is safe, others have speculated on the significance of one\u00a0image in particular\u00a0that includes a photo frame in the background featuring Winnie the Pooh.", "Winnie the Pooh has\u00a0special meaning in China, where the character has been used as a mocking stand-in for President Xi Jinping.", "Several years ago,\u00a0images, memes and gifs of the honey-seeking bear\u00a0disappeared from China's corner of the internet as he suffered an apparent ban.", "The Chinese government runs a very comprehensive program of internet censorship and are quick to\u00a0scrub\u00a0images of the children's book character.", "The pictures has caused some to question whether or not it was a deliberate attempt by her to draw attention to the image of the cartoon bear.", "Online discussion around the significance of the Winnie the Pooh\u00a0image has some people believing it could be a subtle message from the tennis star.", "China critic\u00a0Leta Hong Fincher said the photo of Winnie the Pooh was a \"distress signal\".\u00a0", "Others have ridiculed the suggestion, dismissing it as mere coincidence or exaggeration on the part of China-watchers.\u00a0", "Despite what the photos may or may not allude to,\u00a0Pichamon Yeophantong, a political scientist and China expert at UNSW Canberra, said the speculation surrounding the\u00a0photo reflects the uncertainty and lack of knowledge we have when it comes to understanding the machinations of the Chinese government.", "\"The concern and anxiety surrounding Peng Shuai's case demonstrates to us how very little we know about her situation\u2014and how very little we can feasibly come to know about her situation as well,\" Dr Yeonphantong told the ABC.", "Earlier this week, International Olympic Committee (IOC) president Thomas Bach spoke with Ms Peng via video call,\u00a0her first direct contact with sports officials outside China since she disappeared from public view on\u00a02 November.", "The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) and Amnesty International said the call had\u00a0not alleviated the fears around Ms Peng's safety and wellbeing.\u00a0", "\"This video does not change our call for a full, fair and transparent investigation, without censorship, into her allegation of sexual assault, which is the issue that gave rise to our initial concern.\""]
